title: Ongoing siege following car explosion at hotel gate in Somalia's capital
description: Somalia security forces are fighting armed gunmen to end a siege at a hotel in the east African country's capital Mogadishu on Sunday, according to police.

title: Skier found dead after being buried by an avalanche in Utah
description: A skier died after being buried by an avalanche Saturday in the backcountry of Summit County, Utah.

title: Active US military and veterans are overrepresented among initial Capitol attacks, CNN analysis shows
description: Active military personnel and veterans are over-represented among the first 150 people to be arrested and have records released for federal offenses in the violence and insurrection at the US Capitol.

title: Tesla's dirty little secret: Its net profit doesn't come from selling cars
description: Tesla posted its first full year of net income in 2020 -- but not because of sales to its customers.

title: 100-year-old UK fundraising hero Tom Moore hospitalized with Covid-19
description: Tom Moore, the World War II veteran who raised millions for a British charity supporting the UK's National Health Service by walking laps of his garden before his 100th birthday, has been hospitalized with Covid-19 and pneumonia, his daughter Hannah said on Twitter Sunday.

title: Connecticut man arrested for 2004 murder of 16-year-old girl
description: Police in Waterbury, Connecticut, arrested and charged a local man for the murder of a 16-year-old girl whose 2004 death had long been unsolved.

title: Powerful nor'easter could bring up to 18 inches of snow to NYC
description: Over 100 million Americans will feel winter's sting early this week as a powerful nor'easter takes aim at the most densely populated cities along the East Coast.

title: Thousands detained in Russia amid rallies for Alexey Navalny
description: The wife of opposition leader Alexey Navalny was detained Sunday in Moscow, according to the Navalny team, as she joined protesters across the country in rallying in her husband's name.

title: Wendy Williams' biopic is as brutally honest as she is
description: "Wendy Williams: The Movie" chronicles the former shock jock's rise to fame, and shares new intimate details about Williams' struggle with addiction and her divorce. A Lifetime documentary called "Wendy Williams: What a Mess!" aired after the biopic.

title: How lawmakers made it nearly impossible to legalize abortion in Honduras
description: This week, lawmakers in Honduras changed the country's constitution to make it virtually impossible to legalize abortion in the future -- an extreme election-year move that critics warn will further endanger women's health.

title: Russian protester on why he is demonstrating amid security crackdown
description: CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports that thousands of opposition protesters calling for the release of Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny have been detained amid a crackdown by Russian security forces.

title: A culture war is raging in Poland
description: The Polish government has imposed a near-total ban on abortions, including the termination of pregnancies with fetal defects, delivering a major blow to pro-choice advocates and sparking protests in one of Europe's most devout Catholic countries.

title: Angry sports fans armed with fireworks and flares storm team's football field
description: Supporters of the Marseille football club in France marched onto the team's training ground in protest. A fire broke out and forced the club to postpone a match. CNN's Don Riddell has more.

title: Hilton Valentine, guitarist of The Animals, has died at 77
description: The Animals' guitarist Hilton Valentine, best known for the iconic opening riff on the English rock band's arrangement of "The House of the Rising Sun," has died at the age of 77.

title: An autographed Tom Brady rookie card got auctioned for $555,988
description: A Tom Brady rookie football card signed by the superstar quarterback has been auctioned on eBay for $555,988.

title: Biden plans first major foreign policy speech on restoring 'America's place'
description: President Joe Biden plans to deliver his most substantive foreign policy remarks since becoming president on Monday, according to a senior administration official, marking his opening attempt at pivoting away from his predecessor's "America First" approach to the world.

title: The real cost of being the ultimate Samsung fan: Nearly $91,000
description: Samsung, the world's biggest phone maker, is also one of the largest consumer electronics and appliance makers in the world, selling everything from televisions to refrigerators.

title: Gamestop proves the death of the individual investor was greatly exaggerated
description: Say what you will about the GameStop mania. It does illustrate one positive thing about today's stock market: There are still some people willing to invest in individual companies instead of merely tossing their money into index funds.

title: Legal analyst: This may be why Trump's lawyers left
description: Former President Donald Trump's five impeachment defense attorneys have left a little more than a week before his trial is set to begin amid a disagreement over his legal strategy. CNN's Elie Honig breaks down what this means for Trump's case.

title: Why Senate Democrats may struggle in 2022
description: The retirement announcement this week from Sen. Rob Portman is a sign that even as we just finished one election, another one is right around the corner. Democrats seemed to be pleased that the Ohio Republican is stepping aside because beating an incumbent senator is hard.

title: Best moments of 'Saturday Night Live'
description: "Saturday Night Live" returned for its first show of 2021, and it poked fun at Marjorie Taylor Greene, the Capitol insurrection and also includes a kiss between John Krasinski and Pete Davidson.

title: A Chick-fil-A manager saved a drive-thru Covid-19 vaccination clinic after traffic backed up
description: When a South Carolina drive-thru coronavirus vaccine clinic got backed up, leaving people waiting for hours, the town mayor decided to call in a professional for help: a Chick-fil-A manager.

title: US hospitalizations are dropping -- but the next two months will be 'rough,' expert says
description: Covid-19 hospitalizations in the US dropped below 100,000 for the first time in nearly two months, according to data from the COVID Tracking Project.

title: Five of Trump's impeachment defense attorneys leave, less than two weeks before trial
Ikea bought 11,000 acres of forest in Georgia to protect it from development
description: An investment group of Swedish retail giant Ikea has acquired forestland in southeast Georgia to protect the land and its diverse ecosystems from development.

title: Analysis: Trump loses his impeachment team amid unfaltering loyalty from the GOP
The attorneys have stepped aside a little more than a week before the former President's Senate trial is set to begin, according to people familiar with the case.
Pakistan battles 'tsunami' of Covid-19 patients with few vaccines in sight
description: Keeping vigil outside the hospital ward in Karachi, Daniyal Ameen watched his father breathing through a ventilator via a live video link from the intensive care unit (ICU).

title: All Americans must now wear masks on public transport
description: To slow the spread of Covid-19, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued late Friday an order that will require people to wear a face mask while using any form of public transportation, including buses, trains, taxis, airplanes, boats, subways or rideshare vehicles while traveling into, within and out of the US.

title: 9 nuns die of Covid-19 after outbreak at Adrian Dominican Sisters campus in Michigan
description: Before December 20, there had not been any cases of Covid-19 among the nuns living at the Motherhouse campus of the Adrian Dominican Sisters in Adrian, Michigan.

title: Residents of Washington town wonder if QAnon has taken hold of their mayor
description: The 7,000 residents of Sequim, Washington, nestled in a valley on the Olympic peninsula two hours west of Seattle, are grappling with a big question: Has the QAnon conspiracy taken hold of their mayor?

title: New pandemic forecast projects frightening toll
